alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 02 at 1:09PM MST until December 03 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow likely. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, moderate to heavy snow bands expected this afternoon and evening. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory on Sunday, additional moderate to heavy snow showers expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible by Sunday night. * WHERE...Lower Clark Fork Region. Interstate 90 Lookout Pass to Huson. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Sunday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will combine with gusty winds to reduce visibility and create hazardous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
